instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hi Repair People.

I'm new here and would appreciate your help. I'm working on an Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged which i managed to power on. Had damange near SMC, battery controller tps 625, 51980a and few other places. Contacts renewed everywhere that needed. The issue is that when i have the battery and charger plugged in not powering on or if i power on on charger and then plug in the battery it turns off the adapter completely. Also i replaced the charging controller which i took out from an old board for parts. Any advice please? THANKS :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (F7140) on charger only, without battery connected.
Also the exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (ohm scale); remove any power first!
You could have shorted D-S <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, or/and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hi [B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL][/B]

17/18 and 27/28 full short
Voltage on F7140 13.99v
No shorts on <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
"17/18 and 27/28 full short"
Impossible!
Please post EXACT value on ohm scale.

"Voltage on F7140 13.99v
No shorts on <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>"
Are you sure <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is not shorted D-S on high side?
I mean between pins 9-10 (2-10) in schematic, for example...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
You're right <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is shorted  between pins 9-10
Resistance on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 17/18 pin is 0 ohms & 27/28 0 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
"Resistance on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 17/18 pin is 0 ohms & 27/28 0 ohms"
Still impossible!
Look at schematic and guess the values; aprox 2 and 20 ohms respectively...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
You're right, but my multimeter is playing with me :o

27/28 is 20.7 ohms
17/18 is 3.5/3.6 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
OK, that's good; I mean the values, not the multimeter.

Machine works good after <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> changed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Your issue is the charger circuit as 2informaticos said. Replace the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> all at the same time and comment

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> are shorted i replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> but i need to find from another board <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Did you power it up? If so, must replace both again. Do not power up until all 3 are replaced at the same time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: yes i did hahah looking for parts now :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Missing <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> will not burn anything if you power up the board.
However, is no reason to do that...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Update: 
<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> was damaged i replaced it and on contact 2 of it the line was broken <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> so i rewired and now powering on only on battery :p

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: ok so... found some more damaged around SMC made the connections to make sure all good and replaced  <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>. When laptop plugged in shows green light and orange no power on, but soon as i plug in the battery powers on right away and if i unplug the battery turns off and light stays on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
F7140 voltage on charger only?
Be sure to have good traces for <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
F7140 is 3.6v when only on charger 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> was 3.6v only on charger , once battery plugged in power on and jumps to 3.9 and i think it should be 4.8 calculated by the resistance on 7110 and 7111.
I fixed the trace for <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> from <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> powering on now and charging atm hope will be good. One thing now is that the CPU is overheating :D
